_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



The CoreAgri Plant, Humboldt, Tennessee has Anhydrous Ammonia on site that requires protection as defined under the Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation. CoreAgri has implemented a PSM program to provide information to employees to deal with the risks involved with the storage, handling and processing of highly hazardous materials. The program emphas the application of management controls and standard operating procedures when addressing the risks associated with handling or working near highly hazardous chemicals.



The Ammonia System (the System) for CoreAgri utilizes anhydrous ammonia to manufacture various fertilizers.  Anhydrous Ammonia is the only highly hazardous chemical above the PSM threshold quantity on-site.  



The System also contains 28% Aqua Ammonia (Aqua Ammonia), a dilution of Anhydrous Ammonia.  Aqua Ammonia is sold as a product or can be used to manufacture other fertilizer products.



Both Anhydrous Ammonia and Aqua Ammonia are subject to the Environmental Protection Agency Risk Management Plan (RMP) regulations. 



The System maintains a maximum inventory of 22,166 pounds (lbs.) of Anhydrous Ammonia and 65,000 lbs. of  Aqua Ammonia in respective Aboveground Storage Tanks (ASTs).



The worst-case release and the alternate release scenarios are delineated below. EPA's RMP*Comp was used in the consequence analyses. The worst case releases are calculated to be a complete release of the contents of the ASTs. 



Worst Case - Anhydrous Ammonia AST Failure



 Amount Released:        22,166 lbs. in 10 minutes     outside.



Weather Conditions:    77 ?F with a 3.4 mph wind in Class F atmospheric

 stability.



This release would impact the urban area around CoreAgri within a 1.7 mile radius and impact the entire city of Humboldt, Tennessee, a very small portion of northwest Madison County, Tennessee, approximately a 2 mile section of  Middle Fork of the Forked Deer River southwest

of CoreAgri, including the following:



?    8,452 Residents (based on 2010 Census)

?    Humboldt General Hospital

?    Tennessee State Veterans Home

?    4 Additional Nursing Homes

?    5 Day care centers 

?    2 Private pre-schools

?    4 Humboldt City Schools    

?    Jackson State Community College - Humboldt Center

?    37 Churches/Houses of Worship

?    5 City Parks

?    Humboldt Golf & Country Club

?    Canadian National Railroad & CSX Railroad lines through Humboldt, Tennessee



Should there be an Anhydrous Ammonia release that requires assistance, the Humboldt, Tennessee Fire Department (HFD) will respond. The HFD has several trained Hazardous Material (HAZMAT) technicians that can handle any accidental Anhydrous Ammonia release. The HFD provides emergency response training to designated CoreAgri Emergency Response Team personnel.  Should the need for an evacuation occur, the Humboldt, Tennessee Police Department (HPD) will notify all households identified within a 1.7 mile radius downwind of the plant.



Alternate Case - Anhydrous Ammonia Hose Leak



 Amount Released:        500 lbs. in 10 minutes outside

.

Weather Conditions:    77 ?F with a 6.7 mph wind in Class D atmospheric stability.



This release would impact the urban area around CoreAgri within a 0.2 mile radius and impact  the following within city of Humboldt, Tennessee:



?    50 Residents 

?    2 Day care centers 

?    5 Churches/Houses of Worship



Worst Case - Aqua Ammonia AST Failure



Amount Released:    65,000 lbs. in 10 minutes outside within a 2,400 - square foot dike with a wall height of 1.5 feet



Weather Conditions:    77 ?F with a 3.4 mph wind in Class F atmospheric

 stability.



This release would affect a 0.2 mile radius from the center of the facility and affect the following within city of Humboldt, Tennessee:



?    50 Residents 

?    2 Day care center 

?    5 Churches/Houses of Worship



Should there be an Aqua Ammonia release that requires assistance, the HFD will respond. The HFD has several trained HAZMAT technic

ians that can handle any accidental Aqua Ammonia release. The HFD provides emergency response training to designated CoreAgri Emergency Response Team personnel.  Should the need for an evacuation occur, the HPD will notify all households identified within a 0.2 mile radius downwind of the plant.



Alternate Case - Aqua Ammonia Hose Leak



 Amount Released:        500 lbs. in 10 minutes outside within a 2,400 - square 

                foot dike with a wall height of 1.5 feet

.

Weather Conditions:    77 ?F with a 6.7 mph wind in Class D atmospheric stability.



CoreAgri is in compliance with OSHA PSM and emergency action plan regulations, as well as the EPCRA Section 302 rules. The regularly scheduled maintenance program is the key to maintaining the CoreAgri Ammonia System in good operation.



There have been no reportable accidental releases at CoreAgri during the last five years.



The equipment listed below is inspected daily.



?    Mixer

?    Zinc Plant Auger

?    Zinc Plant Mixer

?    Soluble Plant Mixer

?    All Ammonia Pumps

?    Ammonia Converter

?    All Ammonia Tanks



Annual in-house employee training programs maintain and continually improve safety at CoreAgri.
